meanings.definition: A place where fish are caught or raised for commercial purposes.
meanings.sent1: The fishery by the lake provides fresh seafood to the local market.
meanings.sent2: The fishery on the coast employs many people in the fishing industry.
meanings.sent3: The fishery was so busy that even the fish had to wait in line.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a fishery of ideas, each one ready to be caught and explored.
meanings.sent5: The fishery bustled with activity, the smell of saltwater and fish filling the air.

meanings.definition: The occupation or industry of catching, processing, or selling fish.
meanings.sent1: Working in the fishery requires knowledge of different fish species.
meanings.sent2: The fishery workers were skilled at gutting and cleaning fish efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The fishery business was booming, with fish flying off the shelves.
meanings.sent4: In the fishery of life, he was a master at reeling in success.
meanings.sent5: The fishery trade was competitive, with each seller trying to lure in more customers.

meanings.sent1: Early morning was the best time for fishery in the calm lake.
meanings.sent2: His favorite hobby was fishery, spending hours by the river with his fishing rod.
meanings.sent3: The fishery trip turned into a comedy when they caught an old boot instead of fish.
meanings.sent4: She approached problem-solving like a skilled fishery, patiently waiting for the right solution.
meanings.sent5: The fishery expedition was filled with excitement as they reeled in their biggest catch yet.
